definition: a light sharp jerky stroke or movement
a sound produced by a flick
to move or propel with a light quick movement
examples: flicked her hair back over her shoulder

definition: to activate, deactivate, or change by or as if by flicking a switch
to strike lightly with a quick sharp motion
examples: flicked the horse with a whip
flicked an ash off her sleeve

definition: to go or pass quickly or abruptly

examples: flicked at the spot with his finger
